channel.title: How do you turn your server online?
channel.description: Sorry if it's a dumb question but I don't know to much about computers. :confused: :| :confused: Please help. Thanks

item.title: How do you turn your server online?
item.dc:creator: @Amerks5 Amerks5
item.description:
@Amerks5 wrote:

Go to compile, if its working you should see 3 options, c-compile r-runserver and e-exit. press c then enter e enter on the next screen. Then open runserver and leave that on the whole time.

item.title: How do you turn your server online?
item.dc:creator: @m.dog311 m.dog311
item.description:
@m.dog311 wrote:

You need either no-ip or hamachi, wich i cant get no-ip to work, and for hamachi make your networks, and your server ip is the big numbers at the top of the hamachi window, and keep logging in using that ip untill it lets you in . But make sure you have compiled your server and then ran it. AND KEEP THE RUN WINDOW UP THE WHOLE TIME YOU WANT YOUR SERVER ONLINE!!![br][size=1]Posted on: March 05, 2007, 04:34:26 PM[/size][hr]Oh ya and if anyone here knows why my no-ip isnt working please pm me, i got it made and im port forwarded

Read full topic

item.title: How do you turn your server online?
item.dc:creator: @m.dog311 m.dog311
item.description:
@m.dog311 wrote:

1)hit the start button on the lower left courner of your screen (thats what mine is)
2)hit run in the start menu
3)type cmd then ipconfig/all
4)its the one directly across from DNS server

or you can…
Open up network connections wich is in control panel wich can be found in start
then local area connections
then hit the support tab
and it is the one across from defult gateway

Read full topic
